description: A peculiar stone that can make\ncertain species of Pokémon evolve.\nIt’s as round as a Pokémon Egg.

name: Odd Keystone
description: A vital item that is needed to keep a\nstone tower from collapsing. Voices\ncan be heard from it occasionally.

name: Griseous Orb
description: A glowing orb to be held by Giratina.\nIt boosts the power of Dragon- and\nGhost-type moves when it is held.

name: Douse Drive
description: A cassette to be held by Genesect.\nIt changes Genesect’s Techno Blast\nmove so it becomes Water type.

name: Shock Drive
description: A cassette to be held by Genesect.\nIt changes Genesect’s Techno Blast\nmove so it becomes Electric type.

name: Burn Drive
description: A cassette to be held by Genesect.\nIt changes Genesect’s Techno Blast\nmove so it becomes Fire type.

name: Chill Drive
description: A cassette to be held by Genesect.\nIt changes Genesect’s Techno Blast\nmove so it becomes Ice type.

name: Sweet Heart
description: A piece of cloyingly sweet chocolate.\nWhen consumed, it restores\n20 HP to an injured Pokémon.

name: Adamant Orb
description: A brightly gleaming orb to be held by\nDialga. It boosts the power of Dragon-\nand Steel-type moves when it is held.

name: Lustrous Orb
description: A beautifully glowing orb to be held by\nPalkia. It boosts the power of Dragon-\nand Water-type moves when it is held.

name: Greet Mail
description: Stationery designed to be easy to use\nwhen writing someone for the first time.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Favored Mail
description: Stationery designed to make it easier\nto write about your favorite things.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: RSVP Mail
description: Stationery designed to allow you to\nextend an invitation to the recipient.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Thanks Mail
description: Stationery designed to make it easy\nfor you to express thanks. Have a\nPokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Inquiry Mail
description: Stationery designed to make it easier\nto pose a question about something.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Like Mail
description: Stationery designed to allow you to\nrecommend something to the reader.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Reply Mail
description: Stationery designed to make it easy\nto respond to a letter you received.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Bridge Mail S
description: Stationery featuring an illustration of\na bridge that seems to pierce the sky.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Bridge Mail D
description: Stationery featuring an illustration of a bright-red\ndrawbridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Bridge Mail T
description: Stationery featuring an illustration of a\nhigh-tension steel suspension bridge.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Bridge Mail V
description: Stationery featuring an illustration of\na vintage-looking brick bridge.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Bridge Mail M
description: Stationery featuring an illustration of\na majestically arched bridge.\nHave a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

name: Cheri Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can recover\nfrom paralysis on its own in battle.

name: Chesto Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can recover\nfrom sleep on its own in battle.

name: Pecha Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can recover\nfrom poisoning on its own in battle.

name: Rawst Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can recover\nfrom a burn on its own in battle.

name: Aspear Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can recover\nfrom being frozen on its own in battle.

name: Leppa Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can restore\n10 PP to a depleted move during battle.

name: Oran Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its\nown HP by 10 points during battle.

name: Persim Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can recover\nfrom confusion on its own in battle.

name: Lum Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can recover\nfrom any status condition during battle.

name: Sitrus Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its\nown HP by a small amount during battle.

name: Figy Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the\nuser’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause\nconfusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Wiki Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the\nuser’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause\nconfusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Mago Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the\nuser’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause\nconfusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Aguav Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the\nuser’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause\nconfusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Iapapa Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the\nuser’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause\nconfusion if the user hates the taste.

name: Razz Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCoolness. Its red flesh is spicy when eaten.

name: Bluk Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nBeauty. Its blue flesh is sour when eaten.

name: Nanab Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCuteness. Its pink flesh is sweet when eaten.

name: Wepear Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCleverness. Its green flesh is bitter when eaten.

name: Pinap Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nToughness. Its yellow flesh is sour when eaten.

name: Pomeg Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nUsing it on a Pokémon makes it more\nfriendly but lowers its base HP.

name: Kelpsy Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nUsing it on a Pokémon makes it more\nfriendly but lowers its base Attack.

name: Qualot Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nUsing it on a Pokémon makes it more\nfriendly but lowers its base Defense.

name: Hondew Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nUsing it on a Pokémon makes it more\nfriendly but lowers its base Sp. Atk.

name: Grepa Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nUsing it on a Pokémon makes it more\nfriendly but lowers its base Sp. Def.

name: Tamato Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nUsing it on a Pokémon makes it more\nfriendly but lowers its base Speed.

name: Cornn Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nBeauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Magost Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCuteness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Rabuta Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Nomel Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nToughness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Spelon Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCuteness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Pamtre Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nBeauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Watmel Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Durin Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nCleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Belue Berry
description: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your\nBeauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

name: Occa Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Fire-type attack.

name: Passho Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Water-type attack.

name: Wacan Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Electric-type attack.

name: Rindo Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Grass-type attack.

name: Yache Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Ice-type attack.

name: Chople Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Fighting-type attack.

name: Kebia Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Poison-type attack.

name: Shuca Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Ground-type attack.

name: Coba Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Flying-type attack.

name: Payapa Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Psychic-type attack.

name: Tanga Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Bug-type attack.

name: Charti Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Rock-type attack.

name: Kasib Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Ghost-type attack.

name: Haban Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Dragon-type attack.

name: Colbur Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Dark-type attack.

name: Babiri Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Steel-type attack.

name: Chilan Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry\nwill lessen the damage taken\nfrom one Normal-type attack.

name: Liechi Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, its Attack\nstat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Ganlon Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, its Defense\nstat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Salac Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, its Speed\nstat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Petaya Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Atk\nstat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Apicot Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Def\nstat will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Lansat Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, its critical-hit\nratio will increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Starf Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, one of its stats\nwill sharply increase when it’s in a pinch.

name: Enigma Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, being hit by a\nsupereffective attack will restore its HP.

name: Micle Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, its accuracy will\nincrease just once when it’s in a pinch.

name: Custap Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a Pokémon holds one, it will be able to\nmove first just once when it’s in a pinch.

name: Jaboca Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a physical attack hits the Pokémon\nholding it, the attacker will also be hurt.

name: Rowap Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.\nIf a special attack hits the Pokémon\nholding it, the attacker will also be hurt.

name: Bright Powder
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt casts a tricky glare that lowers\nthe opposing Pokémon’s accuracy.

name: White Herb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt will restore any lowered stat in\nbattle. It can be used only once.

name: Macho Brace
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis stiff, heavy brace helps Pokémon\ngrow strong but cuts Speed in battle.

name: Exp. Share
description: Turning on this special device will\nallow all the Pokémon on your team\nto receive Exp. Points from battles.

name: Quick Claw
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis light, sharp claw lets the\nbearer move first occasionally.

name: Soothe Bell
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe comforting chime of this bell\ncalms the holder, making it friendly.

name: Mental Herb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holder shakes off move-binding effects\nto move freely. It can be used only once.

name: Choice Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis curious headband boosts Attack\nbut only allows the use of one move.

name: King’s Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nWhen the holder successfully inflicts\ndamage, the target may also flinch.

name: Silver Powder
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a shiny, silver powder that will\nboost the power of Bug-type moves.

name: Amulet Coin
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt doubles any prize money received\nif the holding Pokémon joins a battle.

name: Cleanse Tag
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt helps keep wild Pokémon away if\nthe holder is the head of the party.

name: Soul Dew
description: A wondrous orb to be held by either\nLatios or Latias. It raises both the\nSp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

name: Deep Sea Tooth
description: An item to be held by Clamperl.\nThis fang gleams a sharp silver and\nraises the holder’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: Deep Sea Scale
description: An item to be held by Clamperl.\nThis scale shines with a faint pink and\nraises the holder’s Sp. Def stat.

name: Smoke Ball
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt enables the holder to flee from any\nwild Pokémon encounter without fail.

name: Everstone
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA Pokémon holding this peculiar\nstone is prevented from evolving.

name: Focus Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holder may endure a potential\nKO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.

name: Lucky Egg
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s an egg filled with happiness that\nearns extra Exp. Points in battle.

name: Scope Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a lens for scoping out weak points.\nIt boosts the holder’s critical-hit ratio.

name: Metal Coat
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a special metallic film that can\nboost the power of Steel-type moves.

name: Leftovers
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holder’s HP is slowly but steadily\nrestored throughout every battle.

name: Dragon Scale
description: A very tough and inflexible scale.\nDragon-type Pokémon may be\nholding this item when caught.

name: Light Ball
description: An item to be held by Pikachu.\nIt’s a puzzling orb that boosts\nits Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

name: Soft Sand
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a loose, silky sand that boosts\nthe power of Ground-type moves.

name: Hard Stone
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a durable stone that boosts\nthe power of Rock-type moves.

name: Miracle Seed
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a seed imbued with life force that\nboosts the power of Grass-type moves.

name: Black Glasses
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA pair of shady-looking glasses that\nboost the power of Dark-type moves.

name: Black Belt
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis belt helps the wearer to focus and\nboosts the power of Fighting-type moves.

name: Magnet
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a powerful magnet that boosts\nthe power of Electric-type moves.

name: Mystic Water
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis teardrop-shaped gem boosts\nthe power of Water-type moves.

name: Sharp Beak
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a long, sharp beak that boosts\nthe power of Flying-type moves.

name: Poison Barb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis small, poisonous barb boosts\nthe power of Poison-type moves.

name: Never-Melt Ice
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a piece of ice that repels heat\neffects and boosts Ice-type moves.

name: Spell Tag
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a sinister, eerie tag that boosts\nthe power of Ghost-type moves.

name: Twisted Spoon
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis spoon is imbued with telekinetic\npower and boosts Psychic-type moves.

name: Charcoal
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a combustible fuel that boosts\nthe power of Fire-type moves.

name: Dragon Fang
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis hard and sharp fang boosts\nthe power of Dragon-type moves.

name: Silk Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a sumptuous scarf that boosts\nthe power of Normal-type moves.

name: Up-Grade
description: A transparent device somehow\nfilled with all sorts of data.\nIt was produced by Silph Co.

name: Shell Bell
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holder regains a little HP every\ntime it inflicts damage on others.

name: Sea Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis incense has a curious aroma that\nboosts the power of Water-type moves.

name: Lax Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe beguiling aroma of this incense\nmay cause attacks to miss its holder.

name: Lucky Punch
description: An item to be held by Chansey.\nThis pair of lucky boxing gloves will\nboost Chansey’s critical-hit ratio.

name: Metal Powder
description: An item to be held by Ditto.\nExtremely fine yet hard, this odd\npowder boosts the Defense stat.

name: Thick Club
description: An item to be held by Cubone or\nMarowak. It is a hard bone of some\nsort that boosts the Attack stat.

name: Stick
description: An item to be held by Farfetch’d.\nThis very long and stiff stalk of\nleek boosts its critical-hit ratio.

name: Red Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nDuring a contest, it raises the Cool\naspect of the Pokémon holding it.

name: Blue Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nDuring a contest, it raises the Beauty\naspect of the Pokémon holding it.

name: Pink Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nDuring a contest, it raises the Cute\naspect of the Pokémon holding it.

name: Green Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nDuring a contest, it raises the Clever\naspect of the Pokémon holding it.

name: Yellow Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nDuring a contest, it raises the Tough\naspect of the Pokémon holding it.

name: Wide Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a magnifying lens that slightly\nboosts the accuracy of moves.

name: Muscle Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis headband exudes strength, slightly\nboosting the power of physical moves.

name: Wise Glasses
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis thick pair of glasses slightly\nboosts the power of special moves.

name: Expert Belt
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a well-worn belt that slightly boosts\nthe power of supereffective moves.

name: Light Clay
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nProtective moves like Light Screen\nand Reflect will be effective longer.

name: Life Orb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the power of moves, but\nat the cost of some HP on each hit.

name: Power Herb
description: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt allows the holder to immediately use a\nmove that normally requires a turn to charge.

name: Toxic Orb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a bizarre orb that will badly\npoison the holder during battle.

name: Flame Orb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a bizarre orb that will afflict the\nholder with a burn during battle.

name: Quick Powder
description: An item to be held by Ditto.\nExtremely fine yet hard, this odd\npowder boosts the Speed stat.

name: Focus Sash
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder\nhas full HP, it will endure a potential KO\nattack with 1 HP. The item then disappears.

name: Zoom Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder moves after its target\nmoves, its accuracy will be boosted.

name: Metronome
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts moves used consecutively,\nbut only until a different move is used.

name: Iron Ball
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt lowers Speed and allows Ground-type\nmoves to hit Flying-type and levitating holders.

name: Lagging Tail
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is tremendously heavy and makes\nthe holder move slower than usual.

name: Destiny Knot
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder becomes infatuated,\nthe opposing Pokémon will be, too.

name: Black Sludge
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt gradually restores HP to Poison-type\nPokémon. It damages any other type.

name: Icy Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of the move\nHail when it’s used by the holder.

name: Smooth Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of the move\nSandstorm when used by the holder.

name: Heat Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of the move\nSunny Day when used by the holder.

name: Damp Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of the move\nRain Dance when used by the holder.

name: Grip Claw
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt extends the duration of multi-turn\nattacks like Bind and Wrap.

name: Choice Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis curious scarf boosts Speed\nbut only allows the use of one move.

name: Sticky Barb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt damages the holder every turn and may\nlatch on to Pokémon that touch the holder.

name: Power Bracer
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt reduces Speed but allows the holder’s\nAttack stat to grow more after battling.

name: Power Belt
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt reduces Speed but allows the holder’s\nDefense stat to grow more after battling.

name: Power Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt reduces Speed but allows the holder’s\nSp. Atk stat to grow more after battling.

name: Power Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt reduces Speed but allows the holder’s\nSp. Def stat to grow more after battling.

name: Power Anklet
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt reduces Speed but allows the holder’s\nSpeed stat to grow more after battling.

name: Power Weight
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt reduces Speed but allows the holder’s\nmaximum HP to grow more after battling.

name: Shed Shell
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis discarded carapace enables the\nholder to switch out of battle without fail.

name: Big Root
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts the power of HP-stealing\nmoves so the holder recovers more HP.

name: Choice Specs
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThese curious glasses boost Sp. Atk\nbut only allow the use of one move.

name: Flame Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Fire-type moves.

name: Splash Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Water-type moves.

name: Zap Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Electric-type moves.

name: Meadow Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Grass-type moves.

name: Icicle Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ice-type moves.

name: Fist Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Fighting-type moves.

name: Toxic Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Poison-type moves.

name: Earth Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ground-type moves.

name: Sky Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Flying-type moves.

name: Mind Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Psychic-type moves.

name: Insect Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Bug-type moves.

name: Stone Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Rock-type moves.

name: Spooky Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Ghost-type moves.

name: Draco Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Dragon-type moves.

name: Dread Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Dark-type moves.

name: Iron Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt’s a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Steel-type moves.

name: Odd Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis exotic-smelling incense boosts\nthe power of Psychic-type moves.

name: Rock Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis exotic-smelling incense boosts\nthe power of Rock-type moves.

name: Full Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis exotic-smelling incense makes\nthe holder bloated and slow moving.

name: Wave Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis exotic-smelling incense boosts\nthe power of Water-type moves.

name: Rose Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis exotic-smelling incense boosts\nthe power of Grass-type moves.

name: Luck Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt doubles any prize money received\nif the holding Pokémon joins a battle.

name: Pure Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt helps keep wild Pokémon away if\nthe holder is the head of the party.

name: Protector
description: A protective item of some sort.\nIt is extremely stiff and heavy.\nIt’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Electirizer
description: A box packed with a tremendous\namount of electric energy.\nIt’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Magmarizer
description: A box packed with a tremendous\namount of magma energy.\nIt’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Dubious Disc
description: A transparent device\noverflowing with dubious data.\nIts producer is unknown.

name: Reaper Cloth
description: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly\nstrong spiritual energy.\nIt’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Razor Claw
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis sharply hooked claw increases\nthe holder’s critical-hit ratio.

name: Razor Fang
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nWhen the holder successfully inflicts\ndamage, the target may also flinch.

name: TM01
description: The user sharpens its claws to\nboost its Attack stat and accuracy.

name: TM02
description: The user slashes the target with huge,\nsharp claws.

name: TM03
description: The user materializes an odd\npsychic wave to attack the target.\nThis attack does physical damage.

name: TM04
description: The user quietly focuses its mind and\ncalms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and\nSp. Def stats.

name: TM05
description: The target is scared off and a different\nPokémon is dragged out. In the wild,\nthis ends a battle against a single Pokémon.

name: TM06
description: A move that leaves the target\nbadly poisoned. Its poison\ndamage worsens every turn.

name: TM07
description: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five\nturns. It damages all Pokémon except the\nIce type.

name: TM08
description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up\nits body, raising both its Attack and\nDefense stats.

name: TM09
description: The user drenches the target in a special\npoisonous liquid. This move’s power is\ndoubled if the target is poisoned.

name: TM10
description: A unique attack that varies in type\ndepending on the Pokémon using it.

name: TM11
description: The user intensifies the sun\nfor five turns, powering up\nFire-type moves.

name: TM12
description: The target is taunted into a rage\nthat allows it to use only attack\nmoves for three turns.

name: TM13
description: The target is struck with an icy-\ncold beam of energy. This may\nalso leave the target frozen.

name: TM14
description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike\nopposing Pokémon. This may also leave\nthe opposing Pokémon frozen.

name: TM15
description: The target is attacked with a powerful beam.\nThe user can’t move on the next turn.

name: TM16
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to\nreduce damage from special attacks\nfor five turns.

name: TM17
description: Enables the user to evade all attacks.\nIts chance of failing rises if it is used\nin succession.

name: TM18
description: The user summons a heavy rain\nthat falls for five turns, powering\nup Water-type moves.

name: TM19
description: The user lands and rests its body.\nIt restores the user’s HP by up to\nhalf of its max HP.

name: TM20
description: The user creates a protective field\nthat prevents status conditions\nfor five turns.

name: TM21
description: A full-power attack that grows more\npowerful the less the user likes\nits Trainer.

name: TM22
description: A two-turn attack. The user gathers\nlight, then blasts a bundled beam on\nthe next turn.

name: TM23
description: The user throws a stone or similar projectile\nto attack an opponent. A flying Pokémon\nwill fall to the ground when it’s hit.

name: TM24
description: A strong electric blast crashes down on\nthe target. This may also leave the target\nwith paralysis.

name: TM25
description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on\nthe target to inflict damage. This may\nalso leave the target with paralysis.

name: TM26
description: The user sets off an earthquake that\nstrikes every Pokémon around it.

name: TM27
description: A full-power attack that grows more\npowerful the more the user likes\nits Trainer.

name: TM28
description: The user burrows, then attacks\non the next turn. It can also\nbe used to exit dungeons.

name: TM29
description: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic\nforce. This may also lower the target’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: TM30
description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the\ntarget. This may also lower the target’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: TM31
description: The user attacks with a swift chop.\nIt can also break barriers, such as\nLight Screen and Reflect.

name: TM32
description: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory\ncopies of itself to raise its evasiveness.

name: TM33
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to\nreduce damage from physical attacks\nfor five turns.

name: TM34
description: The user strikes everything around it by\nswamping the area with a giant sludge wave.\nThis may also poison those hit.

name: TM35
description: The target is scorched with an intense\nblast of fire. This may also leave the\ntarget with a burn.

name: TM36
description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target.\nThis may also poison the target.

name: TM37
description: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned\nto hurt all combatants except for\nRock, Ground, and Steel types.

name: TM38
description: The target is attacked with an intense\nblast of all-consuming fire. This may\nalso leave the target with a burn.

name: TM39
description: Boulders are hurled at the target.\nThis also lowers the target’s Speed\nstat by preventing its movement.

name: TM40
description: The user confounds the target with\nspeed, then slashes.\nThis attack never misses.

name: TM41
description: The user torments and enrages the\ntarget, making it incapable of using\nthe same move twice in a row.

name: TM42
description: An attack move that doubles its power if\nthe user is poisoned, is burned, or\nhas paralysis.

name: TM43
description: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks.\nThen, building up more power,\nthe user raises its Speed stat.

name: TM44
description: The user goes to sleep for two turns.\nThis fully restores the user’s HP and\nheals any status conditions.

name: TM45
description: If it is the opposite gender of the user,\nthe target becomes infatuated and less\nlikely to attack.

name: TM46
description: The user attacks and steals the target’s\nheld item simultaneously. The user can’t\nsteal anything if it already holds an item.

name: TM47
description: The user makes a swift attack on\nthe target’s legs, which lowers the\ntarget’s Speed stat.

name: TM48
description: The user attacks the target with a song.\nOthers can join in the Round and make\nthe attack do greater damage.

name: TM49
description: The user attacks the target with an\nechoing voice. If this move is used\nevery turn, it does greater damage.

name: TM50
description: The user attacks the target at full power.\nThe attack’s recoil harshly lowers the\nuser’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: TM51
description: The target is hit with wings of steel.\nThis may also raise the user’s Defense stat.

name: TM52
description: The user heightens its mental focus and\nunleashes its power.\nThis may also lower the target’s Sp. Def.

name: TM53
description: The user draws power from nature and\nfires it at the target. This may also\nlower the target’s Sp. Def.

name: TM54
description: A restrained attack that prevents the\ntarget from fainting. The target is left\nwith at least 1 HP.

name: TM55
description: The user shoots boiling hot water at\nits target. This may also leave the\ntarget with a burn.

name: TM56
description: The user flings its held item at the target\nto attack. This move’s power and effects\ndepend on the item.

name: TM57
description: The user attacks with an electric\ncharge. The user may use any remaining\nelectricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.

name: TM58
description: The user takes the target into the sky,\nthen drops it during the next turn.\nThe target cannot attack while in the sky.

name: TM59
description: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.\nIf a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a\nBerry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.

name: TM60
description: The user suppresses the target and\nmakes its move go last.

name: TM61
description: The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white\nflame at the target to inflict a burn.

name: TM62
description: The user nimbly strikes the target.\nIf the user is not holding an item,\nthis attack inflicts massive damage.

name: TM63
description: This move prevents the target from\nusing its held item. Its Trainer is\nalso prevented from using items on it.

name: TM64
description: The user attacks everything around it\nby causing a tremendous explosion.\nThe user faints upon using this move.

name: TM65
description: The user slashes with a sharp claw\nmade from shadows.\nCritical hits land more easily.

name: TM66
description: The user stores power, then attacks.\nIf the user moves after the target,\nthis attack’s power will be doubled.

name: TM67
description: The user gets revenge for a fainted ally.\nIf an ally fainted in the previous turn,\nthis move becomes more powerful.

name: TM68
description: The user charges at the target using\nevery bit of its power.\nThe user can’t move on the next turn.

name: TM69
description: The user polishes its body to reduce drag.\nThis can sharply raise the Speed stat.

name: TM70
description: The user flashes a bright light that cuts\nthe target’s accuracy.

name: TM71
description: The user stabs the target with\nsharpened stones from below.\nCritical hits land more easily.

name: TM72
description: After making its attack, the user\nrushes back to switch places with\na party Pokémon in waiting.

name: TM73
description: The user launches a weak jolt of\nelectricity that paralyzes the target.

name: TM74
description: The user tackles the target with a high-speed\nspin. The slower the user compared to the\ntarget, the greater the move’s power.

name: TM75
description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting\nspirit. This sharply raises the user’s\nAttack stat.

name: TM76
description: While resisting, the user attacks the\nopposing Pokémon. This lowers the\nSp. Atk stat of those hit.

name: TM77
description: The user hypnotizes itself into\ncopying any stat change made\nby the target.

name: TM78
description: The user strikes everything around it\nby stomping down on the ground.\nThis lowers the Speed stat of those hit.

name: TM79
description: The user blows its cold breath on the\ntarget. This attack always results in\na critical hit.

name: TM80
description: Large boulders are hurled at the opposing\nPokémon to inflict damage. This may also\nmake the opposing Pokémon flinch.

name: TM81
description: The user slashes at the target by\ncrossing its scythes or claws as if\nthey were a pair of scissors.

name: TM82
description: The target is knocked away, and a different\nPokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this\nends a battle against a single Pokémon.

name: TM83
description: The target is infested and attacked\nfor four to five turns.\nThe target can’t flee during this time.

name: TM84
description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle\nor arm steeped in poison. This may also\npoison the target.

name: TM85
description: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping\ntarget. It absorbs half the damage\ncaused to heal its own HP.

name: TM86
description: The user snares the target with grass and\ntrips it. The heavier the target, the greater\nthe move’s power.

name: TM87
description: The user enrages and confuses the\ntarget. However, this also sharply raises\nthe target’s Attack stat.

name: TM88
description: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses\none of the moves it knows.

name: TM89
description: After making its attack, the user\nrushes back to switch places with a\nparty Pokémon in waiting.

name: TM90
description: The user makes a copy of itself using\nsome of its HP. The copy serves as\nthe user’s decoy.

name: TM91
description: The user gathers all its light energy\nand releases it at once. This may also\nlower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

name: TM92
description: The user creates a bizarre area in\nwhich slower Pokémon get to move\nfirst for five turns.

name: HM01
description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.\nThis can also be used to cut down thin trees.

name: HM02
description: The user soars and then strikes\nits target on the next turn. This can\nalso be used to fly to any familiar town.

name: HM03
description: The user attacks everything around it by\nswamping its surroundings with a giant wave.\nThis can also be used for crossing water.

name: HM04
description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown\nat maximum power. This can also be used\nto move heavy boulders.

name: HM05
description: The user charges at the target and may make it\nflinch. This can also be used to climb a waterfall.

name: HM06
description: The user attacks with a punch. This may\nalso lower the target’s Defense stat.\nThis move can also shatter rocks in the field.

name: Explorer Kit
description: A bag filled with convenient tools for\nexploring. It provides access to the\nUnderground in the Sinnoh region.

name: Loot Sack
description: A sturdy, spacious bag that is\nused to carry any treasures or\nloot obtained in the coal mine.

name: Rule Book
description: It lists the rules for holding battles.\nFor Link Battles, you may choose\nwhich set of rules you wish to use.

name: Poké Radar
description: A tool that can search out Pokémon\nthat are hiding in the tall grass. Its\nbattery is recharged as you walk.

name: Point Card
description: A card that lists how many\nBattle Points you have earned.

name: Journal
description: A notebook that keeps a day-to-day\nrecord of your adventure so far.

name: Seal Case
description: A case for storing Seals that can be\napplied to the exteriors of Poké Balls.

name: Fashion Case
description: A lovely case to store colorful Props\nfor your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

name: Seal Bag
description: A tiny bag that can hold 10 Seals\nfor decorating Poké Balls.

name: Pal Pad
description: A convenient notepad that is used to\nregister your Friends and friend codes\nand keep a record of your gameplay.

name: Works Key
description: A large key for operating the doors of\nthe Valley Windworks in the canyon.\nIt was held by a Team Galactic Grunt.

name: Old Charm
description: An ancient good-luck charm made\nof Pokémon bones to be taken to\nthe elder of Celestic Town.

name: Galactic Key
description: A card key for disengaging the security\nsystems in the Galactic HQ. Losing it\ncan result in punishment, apparently.

name: Red Chain
description: A mythical chain that is said to link\nthe Legendary Pokémon that created\nthe Sinnoh region.

name: Town Map
description: A very convenient map that can be\nviewed anytime. It even shows you\nyour present location in the region.

name: Vs. Seeker
description: A device that indicates Trainers who\nwant to battle. Its battery charges\nwhile you walk.

name: Coin Case
description: A case for holding coins obtained\nat the Game Corner. It can hold up\nto 50,000 coins.

name: Old Rod
description: An old and beat-up fishing rod.\nUse it at any body of water to\nfish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Good Rod
description: A new, good-quality fishing rod.\nUse it at any body of water to\nfish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Super Rod
description: An awesome, high-tech fishing rod.\nUse it at any body of water to\nfish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Sprayduck
description: A watering can shaped like a Psyduck.\nIt helps promote the healthy growth of\nany Berries planted in good, soft soil.

name: Poffin Case
description: A case for storing Poffins cooked from Berries.

name: Bike
description: A folding Bike that enables a rider to get\naround much faster than with Running Shoes.

name: Suite Key
description: A key to one of the suites at a certain\nluxury hotel by a lake. For some odd\nreason, it often disappears.

name: Oak’s Letter
description: A letter from Professor Oak.\nWritten in it is a request for you\nto go to Route 224.

name: Lunar Wing
description: A feather that glows like the moon.\nIt’s said to possess the power to\ndispel nightmares.

name: Member Card
description: A card needed for entering the inn in\nCanalave City. Oddly, the last date\nmarked on it was 50 years ago.

name: Azure Flute
description: A flute that puts out echoing sounds\nthat do not seem to be of this world.\nNo one knows who made it.

name: S.S. Ticket
description: A ticket required for sailing on the\nferry S.S. Aqua. It has a drawing\nof a ship on its front.

name: Contest Pass
description: A pass required for entering Pokémon\nContests. It has a drawing of an award\nribbon on its front.

name: Magma Stone
description: A stone formed by boulders melting in\nintensely hot magma, then hardening.\nMagma remains sealed inside it.

name: Parcel
description: A parcel entrusted into your care.\nYou are supposed to deliver it to your\nchildhood friend who left Twinleaf Town.

name: Coupon 1
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a\nPokémon Watch—Pokétch for short.\nThree coupons are needed.

name: Coupon 2
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a\nPokémon Watch—Pokétch for short.\nThree coupons are needed.

name: Coupon 3
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a\nPokémon Watch—Pokétch for short.\nThree coupons are needed.

name: Storage Key
description: The key to Team Galactic’s sinister\nwarehouse located at the edge of\nVeilstone City.

name: Secret Potion
description: A fantastic medicine dispensed by the\npharmacy in Cianwood City. It fully\nheals a Pokémon of any ailment.

name: Vs. Recorder
description: An amazing device that can record a\nbattle between friends or the battles\nat certain special battle facilities.

name: Gracidea
description: A flower sometimes bundled in\nbouquets to convey gratitude on\nspecial occasions like birthdays.

name: Secret Key
description: A high-tech key that has to be used at\na specific location. It emits a special\nelectronic signal to open a door.

name: Apricorn Box
description: A handy box where you can store\nup to 99 of each kind of Apricorn.

name: Unown Report
description: A report of all the discovered kinds\nof Unown.

name: Berry Pots
description: Handy containers for cultivating\nBerries wherever you go.

name: Dowsing Machine
description: This high-tech machine shows the location\nof invisible items. It’s attached to the head\nwhen in use.

name: Blue Card
description: A card to save points for the\nBuena’s Password show.

name: Slowpoke Tail
description: A very tasty tail of something.\nIt can be sold at a high price to shops.

name: Clear Bell
description: A very old-fashioned bell that\nmakes a gentle ringing sound.

name: Card Key
description: A card key that opens a shutter in the\nRadio Tower.

name: Basement Key
description: A key that opens a door in the\nGoldenrod Tunnel.

name: Squirt Bottle
description: A bottle used for watering plants in the\nBerry Pots.

name: Red Scale
description: A scale from a red Gyarados.\nIt glows red like a flame.

name: Lost Item
description: The Mime Jr. doll that was lost by\nthe Copycat.

name: Pass
description: A pass required for riding the Magnet\nTrain. It allows you to ride whenever\nand however much you’d like.

name: Machine Part
description: An important part of a machine that\nwas stolen from the Power Plant.

name: Silver Wing
description: A strange, silvery feather\nthat sparkles.

name: Rainbow Wing
description: A mystical rainbow feather\nthat sparkles.

name: Mystery Egg
description: A mysterious Egg obtained from Mr. Pokémon.\nWhat is in the Egg is unknown.

name: Red Apricorn
description: A red Apricorn.\nIt assails your nostrils.

name: Blue Apricorn
description: A blue Apricorn.\nIt smells a bit like grass.

name: Yellow Apricorn
description: A yellow Apricorn.\nIt has an invigorating scent.

name: Green Apricorn
description: A green Apricorn.\nIt has a mysterious, aromatic scent.

name: Pink Apricorn
description: A pink Apricorn.\nIt has a nice, sweet scent.

name: White Apricorn
description: A white Apricorn.\nIt doesn’t smell like anything.

name: Black Apricorn
description: A black Apricorn.\nIt has a scent beyond one’s experience.

name: Fast Ball
description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to\ncatch Pokémon that are usually\nvery quick to run away.

name: Level Ball
description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to\ncatch Pokémon that are at a lower\nlevel than your own Pokémon.

name: Lure Ball
description: A Poké Ball that is good for catching\nPokémon that you reel in with a Rod\nwhile out fishing.

name: Heavy Ball
description: A Poké Ball that is better than usual\nat catching very heavy Pokémon.

name: Love Ball
description: A Poké Ball that works best when\ncatching a Pokémon that is of the\nopposite gender of your Pokémon.

name: Friend Ball
description: A strange Poké Ball that will make\nthe wild Pokémon caught with it more\nfriendly toward you immediately.

name: Moon Ball
description: A Poké Ball that will make it easier\nto catch Pokémon that can evolve\nusing a Moon Stone.

name: Sport Ball
description: A special Poké Ball that is used\nduring the Bug-Catching Contest.

name: Park Ball
description: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

name: Photo Album
description: A nice photo album for storing all the\nphotos taken along your adventure.

name: GB Sounds
description: A music player that allows you to listen\nto nostalgic songs. It’s operated with\nthe flip of a single switch.

name: Tidal Bell
description: A very old-fashioned bell that\nmakes a gentle ringing sound.

name: Rage Candy Bar
description: Mahogany Town’s famous candy.\nWhen consumed, it restores\n20 HP to an injured Pokémon.

name: Data Card 01
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many victories\nyou have had in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 02
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many losses\nyou have had in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 03
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon dashed in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 04
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon jumped in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 05
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Hurdle Dash.

name: Data Card 06
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Relay Run.

name: Data Card 07
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Pennant Capture.

name: Data Card 08
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Block Smash.

name: Data Card 09
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Disc Catch.

name: Data Card 10
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Snow Throw.

name: Data Card 11
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many points your\nPokémon scored in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 12
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon failed in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 13
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times\nyour Pokémon impeded themselves.

name: Data Card 14
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon tackled in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 15
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon fell down in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 16
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Ring Drop.

name: Data Card 17
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Lamp Jump.

name: Data Card 18
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Circle Push.

name: Data Card 19
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many Link\nPokéathlon wins you have had.

name: Data Card 20
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many Link\nPokéathlon losses you have had.

name: Data Card 21
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times\nyou have won a Pokéathlon event.

name: Data Card 22
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times\nyou have lost a Pokéathlon event.

name: Data Card 23
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nswitched Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 24
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\nwon the Pokéathlon’s Goal Roll.

name: Data Card 25
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times your\nPokémon won individual prizes.

name: Data Card 26
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how many times you\ninstructed your Pokémon.

name: Data Card 27
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a\ncard that shows how much time you\nspent participating in the Pokéathlon.

name: Jade Orb
description: A shiny green orb that is said to have\na legend tied to it. It’s known to have a\ndeep connection with the Hoenn region.

name: Lock Capsule
description: A sturdy Capsule that can only\nbe opened with a special key.

name: Red Orb
description: A shiny red orb that is said to have\na legend tied to it. It’s known to have a\ndeep connection with the Hoenn region.

name: Blue Orb
description: A shiny blue orb that is said to have\na legend tied to it. It’s known to have a\ndeep connection with the Hoenn region.

name: Enigma Stone
description: A crystal ball that was excavated from\nthe ground. It’s a very beautiful stone that\nis covered with bits of rock and earth.

name: Prism Scale
description: A mysterious scale that causes\na certain Pokémon to evolve.\nIt shines in rainbow colors.

name: Eviolite
description: A mysterious Evolutionary lump. When\nheld by a Pokémon that can still evolve,\nit raises both Defense and Sp. Def.

name: Float Stone
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis very light stone reduces the\nweight of a Pokémon when held.

name: Rocky Helmet
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder is hit, the attacker will\nalso be damaged upon contact.

name: Air Balloon
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThe holder will float in the air until hit.\nOnce hit, this item will burst.

name: Red Card
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nWhen the holder is hit by an attack,\nthe attacker is removed from battle.

name: Ring Target
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nMoves that normally have no effect\nwill land on a Pokémon holding it.

name: Binding Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nA band that increases the power of\nbinding moves used by the holder.

name: Absorb Bulb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts Sp. Atk if hit with a Water-\ntype attack. It can only be used once.

name: Cell Battery
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts Attack if hit with an Electric-\ntype attack. It can only be used once.

name: Eject Button
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIf the holder is hit by an attack, it\nwill be switched out of battle.

name: Fire Gem
description: A gem with an essence of fire.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Fire-type move one time.

name: Water Gem
description: A gem with an essence of water.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Water-type move one time.

name: Electric Gem
description: A gem with an essence of electricity.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power of\nan Electric-type move one time.

name: Grass Gem
description: A gem with an essence of nature.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Grass-type move one time.

name: Ice Gem
description: A gem with an essence of ice.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof an Ice-type move one time.

name: Fighting Gem
description: A gem with an essence of combat.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Fighting-type move one time.

name: Poison Gem
description: A gem with an essence of poison.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Poison-type move one time.

name: Ground Gem
description: A gem with an essence of land.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Ground-type move one time.

name: Flying Gem
description: A gem with an essence of air.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Flying-type move one time.

name: Psychic Gem
description: A gem with an essence of the mind.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Psychic-type move one time.

name: Bug Gem
description: A gem with an insect-like essence.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Bug-type move one time.

name: Rock Gem
description: A gem with an essence of rock.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Rock-type move one time.

name: Ghost Gem
description: A gem with a spectral essence.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Ghost-type move one time.

name: Dragon Gem
description: A gem with a draconic essence.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Dragon-type move one time.

name: Dark Gem
description: A gem with an essence of darkness.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Dark-type move one time.

name: Steel Gem
description: A gem with an essence of steel.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Steel-type move one time.

name: Normal Gem
description: A gem with an ordinary essence.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Normal-type move one time.

name: Health Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon.\nIt slightly increases the base\nHP of a single Pokémon.

name: Muscle Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon.\nIt slightly increases the base Attack\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Resist Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon.\nIt slightly increases the base Defense\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Genius Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon.\nIt slightly increases the base Sp. Atk\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Clever Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon.\nIt slightly increases the base Sp. Def\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Swift Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon.\nIt slightly increases the base Speed\nstat of a single Pokémon.

name: Pretty Wing
description: Though this feather is beautiful,\nit’s just a regular feather and\nhas no effect on Pokémon.

name: Cover Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat once lived in the sea. It appears\nas though it could be part of its back.

name: Plume Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat once lived in the sky. It looks as\nif it could come from part of its wing.

name: Liberty Pass
description: A special pass to go to Liberty Garden.\nBoard the ship in Castelia City.

name: Pass Orb
description: A mysterious orb containing the power\nof the Unova region, to be used when\ngenerating Pass Power.

name: Dream Ball
description: A special Poké Ball that appears in your\nBag out of nowhere in the Entree Forest.\nIt can catch any Pokémon.

name: Poké Toy
description: A toy that attracts the attention of a\nPokémon. It guarantees escape from\nany battle with wild Pokémon.

name: Prop Case
description: A lovely case to store colorful Props\nfor your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

name: Dragon Skull
description: A skull of a Pokémon that was said to have\nbraved the angry waters to fly around the world.

name: Balm Mushroom
description: A rare mushroom that gives off a nice fragrance.\nIt can be sold at a high price to shops.

name: Big Nugget
description: A big nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous\ngleam. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

name: Pearl String
description: Very large pearls that sparkle in a pretty silver\ncolor. They can be sold at a high price to shops.

name: Comet Shard
description: A shard that fell to the ground when a comet\napproached. It can be sold at a high price\nto shops.

name: Relic Copper
description: A copper coin used by an ancient\ncivilization about 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Silver
description: A silver coin used by an ancient\ncivilization about 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Gold
description: A gold coin used by an ancient\ncivilization about 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Vase
description: A fragile vase made by an ancient\ncivilization about 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Band
description: A heavy bracelet made by an ancient\ncivilization about 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Statue
description: A stone figurine made by an ancient\ncivilization about 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Crown
description: A heavy crown made by an ancient\ncivilization about 3,000 years ago.

name: Casteliacone
description: Castelia City’s specialty, soft-serve\nice cream. It heals all the status\nproblems of a single Pokémon.

name: Dire Hit 2
description: It can be used many times to raise the\ncritical-hit ratio of one Pokémon. It\nwears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Speed 2
description: It sharply raises the Speed stat of a\nPokémon in battle. It wears off if\nthe Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Atk 2
description: It sharply raises the Sp. Atk stat of a\nPokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Def 2
description: It sharply raises the Sp. Def stat of a\nPokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Defense 2
description: It sharply raises the Defense stat\nof a Pokémon in battle. It wears off\nif the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Attack 2
description: It sharply raises the Attack stat of a\nPokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Accuracy 2
description: It sharply raises the accuracy of a\nPokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Speed 3
description: It drastically raises the Speed stat of\na Pokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Atk 3
description: It drastically raises the Sp. Atk stat\nof a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if\nthe Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Def 3
description: It drastically raises the Sp. Def stat\nof a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if\nthe Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Defense 3
description: It drastically raises the Defense stat\nof a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if\nthe Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Attack 3
description: It drastically raises the Attack stat\nof a Pokémon in battle. It wears off if\nthe Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Accuracy 3
description: It drastically raises the accuracy of a\nPokémon in battle. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Speed 6
description: It raises the Speed stat of a Pokémon\nin battle immensely. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Atk 6
description: It raises the Sp. Atk stat of a Pokémon\nin battle immensely. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Def 6
description: It raises the Sp. Def stat of a Pokémon\nin battle immensely. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Defense 6
description: It raises the Defense stat of a Pokémon\nin battle immensely. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Attack 6
description: It raises the Attack stat of a Pokémon\nin battle immensely. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Accuracy 6
description: It raises the accuracy of a Pokémon\nin battle immensely. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: Ability Urge
description: When used, it activates the\nAbility of an ally Pokémon.

name: Item Drop
description: When used, it causes an ally\nPokémon to drop a held item.

name: Item Urge
description: When used, it causes an ally\nPokémon to use its held item.

name: Reset Urge
description: When used, it restores any stat\nchanges of an ally Pokémon.

name: Dire Hit 3
description: It can be used many times to greatly\nraise a Pokémon’s critical-hit ratio. It\nwears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: Light Stone
description: Reshiram’s body was destroyed and\nchanged into this stone. It is said to\nbe waiting for the emergence of a hero.

name: Dark Stone
description: Zekrom’s body was destroyed and\nchanged into this stone. It is said to\nbe waiting for the emergence of a hero.

name: TM93
description: The user shrouds itself in electricity\nand smashes into its target.\nThis also damages the user a little.

name: TM94
description: An attack whose additional effects\ndepend upon where it was used.\nCan also be used to make a Secret Base.

name: TM95
description: The user yells as if it’s ranting about\nsomething, which lowers the Sp. Atk stat\nof opposing Pokémon.

name: Xtransceiver
description: A high-tech transceiver with a\ncamera function. It allows up to\nfour-way calls.

name: Gram 1
description: An important letter that\nWingull delivers.

name: Gram 2
description: An important letter that\nWingull delivers.

name: Gram 3
description: An important letter that\nWingull delivers.

name: Xtransceiver
description: A high-tech transceiver with a\ncamera function. It allows up to\nfour-way calls.

name: Medal Box
description: A box-shaped machine\nthat stores Medals and\nMedal information.

name: DNA Splicers
description: A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a\ncertain Pokémon. They are said to\nhave been one in the beginning.

name: DNA Splicers
description: A splicer that separates Kyurem\nand a certain Pokémon when\nthey have been fused.

name: Permit
description: A permit that is needed to\nenter the Nature Preserve.\nNot many know about it.

name: Oval Charm
description: An oval charm said to increase\nthe chance of Pokémon Eggs\nbeing found at the Day Care.

name: Shiny Charm
description: A shiny charm said to increase\nthe chance of finding a Shiny\nPokémon in the wild.

name: Plasma Card
description: A card key needed to enter the\npassword inside the Plasma Frigate.

name: Grubby Hanky
description: A handkerchief dropped by\na regular at Café Warehouse.\nIt smells faintly like a Pokémon.

name: Colress Machine
description: A special device that wrings out\nthe potential of Pokémon.\nIt is an imperfect prototype.

name: Dropped Item
description: The Xtransceiver found at the\nNimbasa City amusement park.\nIt seems it belongs to a boy.

name: Dropped Item
description: The Xtransceiver found at the\nNimbasa City amusement park.\nIt seems it belongs to a girl.

name: Reveal Glass
description: A looking glass that reveals the truth.\nIt’s a mysterious glass that returns\na Pokémon to its original shape.

name: Weakness Policy
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nAttack and Sp. Atk sharply increase\nif the holder is hit with a move it’s weak to.

name: Assault Vest
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThis offensive vest raises Sp. Def\nbut prevents the use of status moves.

name: Holo Caster
description: A device that allows users to receive\nand view hologram clips at any time.\nIt is also used to chat with others.

name: Prof’s Letter
description: A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote\nto your mother. A faint but pleasant\nperfume seems to cling to the paper.

name: Roller Skates
description: Attaches roller skates to the bottom\nof your shoes, allowing you to glide\nquickly around and perform tricks.

name: Pixie Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt is a stone tablet that boosts the\npower of Fairy-type moves.

name: Ability Capsule
description: A capsule that allows a Pokémon with\ntwo Abilities to switch between these\nAbilities when it is used.

name: Whipped Dream
description: A soft and sweet treat made of fluffy,\npuffy, whipped and whirled cream.\nIt’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Sachet
description: A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes\nthat are just slightly too overwhelming.\nYet it’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Luminous Moss
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts Sp. Def if hit with a Water-\ntype attack. It can only be used once.

name: Snowball
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nIt boosts Attack if hit with an Ice-type\nattack. It can only be used once.

name: Safety Goggles
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon.\nThese goggles protect the holder from\nboth weather-related damage and powder.

name: Poké Flute
description: A flute which can play with such a\nbeautiful tone that even sleeping\nPokémon find themselves roused.

name: Rich Mulch
description: A fertilizer for growing Berries.\nHowever, it appears to be unsuitable for\nthe soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

name: Surprise Mulch
description: A fertilizer for growing Berries.\nHowever, it appears to be unsuitable for\nthe soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

name: Boost Mulch
description: A fertilizer for growing Berries.\nHowever, it appears to be unsuitable for\nthe soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

name: Amaze Mulch
description: A fertilizer for growing Berries.\nHowever, it appears to be unsuitable for\nthe soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

name: Gengarite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Gengar hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Gardevoirite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Gardevoir hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Ampharosite

name: Aerodactylite

name: Kangaskhanite

name: Gyaradosite

name: Charizardite Y
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Charizard hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Alakazite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Alakazam hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Heracronite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Heracross hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Mawilite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Mawile hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Manectite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Manectric hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Garchompite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Garchomp hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Latiasite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Latias hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Latiosite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Latios hold it, and this stone will\nenable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Roseli Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will\nlessen the damage taken from one\nsupereffective Fairy-type attack.

name: Kee Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry\nwill increase the holder’s Defense\nif it’s hit with a physical move.

name: Maranga Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the\nholder’s Sp. Def if it’s hit with a special move.

name: Sprinklotad
description: A watering can shaped like a Lotad.\nIt helps promote the healthy growth of\nany Berries planted in good, soft soil.

name: TM96
description: An attack that makes use of nature’s\npower. Its effects vary depending on\nthe user’s environment.

name: TM97
description: The user releases a horrible aura\nimbued with dark thoughts. This\nmay also make the target flinch.

name: TM98
description: Striking opponents over and over\nmakes the user’s fists harder.\nHitting a target raises the Attack stat.

name: TM99
description: The user damages opposing Pokémon\nby emitting a powerful flash.

name: TM100
description: The user tells the target a secret, and\nthe target loses its ability to concentrate.\nThis lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: Power Plant Pass
description: This pass serves as an ID card\nfor gaining access to the power\nplant that lies along Route 13.

name: Mega Ring
description: This ring contains an untold power that\nsomehow enables Pokémon carrying\nMega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Intriguing Stone
description: A rather curious stone that might appear valuable\nto some. It’s all in the eye of the beholder.

name: Common Stone
description: A perfectly normal stone that might\nappear to be valuable to some.\nIt’s all in the eye of the beholder.

name: Discount Coupon
description: This special coupon allows you to\nbuy items at a discount when you\nare shopping at a boutique.

name: Elevator Key
description: A card key that activates the elevator\nin Lysandre Labs.\nIt is emblazoned with Team Flare’s logo.

name: TMV Pass
description: A commuter pass that allows the\nholder to ride the TMV between Lumiose\nCity and Kiloude City at any time.

name: Honor of Kalos
description: A precious symbol that is awarded\nonly to an individual who has done\ngreat things for the Kalos region.

name: Adventure Rules
description: This book contains all the points a new\nTrainer needs to know on a journey.\nIt was handmade by a kind friend.

name: Strange Souvenir
description: An ornament depicting a Pokémon\nthat is venerated as a protector\nin some region far from Kalos.

name: Lens Case
description: A rather chic-looking case\nfor carrying contact lenses.

name: Travel Trunk
description: A light and yet incredibly effective\ntrunk, which can contain every last\npiece of clothing that can be bought.

name: Lumiose Galette
description: A popular treat in Lumiose City.\nIt can be used once to heal all the\nstatus conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Shalour Sable
description: Shalour City’s famous shortbread.\nIt can be used once to heal all the\nstatus conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Jaw Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat once lived on the land. It looks as\nif it could be a piece of a large jaw.

name: Sail Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon\nthat once lived on the land. It looks\nlike the impression from a skin sail.

name: Looker Ticket
description: A ticket that was handmade by\nLooker. It’s decorated with a\nliberal amount of glittery paint.

name: Bike
description: A folding Bike that enables a rider to get\naround much faster than with Running Shoes.

name: Holo Caster
description: A device that allows users to receive\nand view hologram clips at any time.\nIt is also used to chat with others.

name: Fairy Gem
description: A gem with an essence of the fey.\nWhen held, it strengthens the power\nof a Fairy-type move one time.

name: Mega Charm
description: This charm contains an untold power\nthat somehow enables Pokémon carrying\nMega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Glove
description: This glove contains an untold power\nthat somehow enables Pokémon carrying\nMega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mach Bike
description: This folding Bike more than\ndoubles your movement speed.

name: Acro Bike
description: This folding Bike allows you to perform\nactions such as wheelies and bunny hops.

name: Wailmer Pail
description: This is a tool for watering Berries you planted\nto make them grow more quickly.

name: Devon Parts
description: A case that contains mechanical parts of\nsome sort made by the Devon Corporation.

name: Soot Sack
description: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

name: Basement Key
description: The key to New Mauville, which was\nconstructed beneath Mauville City.

name: Pokéblock Kit
description: A set containing a Berry Blender for making\nPokéblocks and a Pokéblock Case for\nstoring Pokéblocks.

name: Letter
description: An extremely important letter to Steven\nfrom the President of Devon Corporation.

name: Eon Ticket
description: The ticket required for sailing on a\nferry to the Southern Island. Does Norman,\nthe Petalburg Gym Leader, know a secret?!

name: Scanner
description: A device found inside Sea Mauville.

name: Go-Goggles
description: Nifty goggles to protect eyes\nfrom desert sandstorms.

name: Meteorite
description: A Meteorite originally found at Meteor Falls.\nYou got it at Mt. Chimney.

name: Key to Room 1
description: A key that opens a door\ninside Sea Mauville.

name: Key to Room 2
description: A key that opens a door\ninside Sea Mauville.

name: Key to Room 4
description: A key that opens a door\ninside Sea Mauville.

name: Key to Room 6
description: A key that opens a door\ninside Sea Mauville.

name: Storage Key
description: A key that opens the storage\nhold inside Sea Mauville.

name: Devon Scope
description: A special device made by Devon Corporation that\nsignals the presence of any unseen Pokémon.

name: S.S. Ticket
description: Ticket required for sailing on a ferry.

name: HM07
description: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and\nattacks on the second turn. It can be used to\ndive deep in the ocean.

name: Devon Scuba Gear
description: A device made by Devon Corporation that\nprovides oxygen to users during the use of Dive.

name: Contest Costume
description: A very cool suit to be worn during\nthe Contest Spectacular.

name: Contest Costume
description: A very cute dress to be worn during\nthe Contest Spectacular.

name: Magma Suit
description: A suit made with the collective\ntechnological know-how of Team Magma.\nIt can withstand any impact.

name: Aqua Suit
description: A suit made with the collective\ntechnological know-how of Team Aqua.\nIt can withstand any impact.

name: Pair of Tickets
description: Tickets for two to the astronomical show\nbeing held at the Mossdeep Space Center.

name: Mega Bracelet
description: This cuff contains an untold power that\nsomehow enables Pokémon carrying\na Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Pendant
description: This necklace contains an untold power\nthat somehow enables Pokémon carrying\na Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Glasses
description: These glasses contain an untold power\nthat somehow enables Pokémon carrying\na Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Anchor
description: This anchor contains an untold power\nthat somehow enables Pokémon carrying\na Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Stickpin
description: This stickpin contains an untold power\nthat somehow enables Pokémon carrying\na Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Tiara
description: This tiara contains an untold power that\nsomehow enables Pokémon carrying\na Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Anklet
description: This anklet contains an untold power\nthat somehow enables Pokémon carrying\na Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Meteorite
description: A Meteorite that you got at Mt. Chimney.\nIt gives off a faint glow.

name: Swampertite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Swampert hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Sceptilite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Sceptile hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Sablenite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Sableye hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Altarianite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Altaria hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Galladite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Gallade hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Audinite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Audino hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Metagrossite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Metagross hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Sharpedonite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Sharpedo hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Slowbronite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Slowbro hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Steelixite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Steelix hold it, and this stone\nwill enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Pidgeotite
